trans-unit.source: Retrieves the current mapping for a particular MS-DOS device name

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves the current mapping for a particular MS-DOS device name

target.mrk: Retrieves the current mapping for a particular MS-DOS device name

trans-unit.source: The name of the MS-DOS device.

seg-source.mrk: The name of the MS-DOS device.

target.mrk: The name of the MS-DOS device.

trans-unit.source: The current mapping for the specified device. If the $sDevice parameter is empty string, return array

seg-source.mrk: The current mapping for the specified device.
If the $sDevice parameter is empty string, return array

target.mrk: The current mapping for the specified device.
If the $sDevice parameter is empty string, return array

trans-unit.source: of all existing MS-DOS device names (for example, "\Device\HarddiskVolume1" or "\Device\Floppy0").

seg-source.mrk: of all existing MS-DOS device names (for example, "\Device\HarddiskVolume1" or "\Device\Floppy0").

target.mrk: of all existing MS-DOS device names (for example, "\Device\HarddiskVolume1" or "\Device\Floppy0").

trans-unit.source: The zeroth array element contains the number of names.

seg-source.mrk: The zeroth array element contains the number of names.

target.mrk: The zeroth array element contains the number of names.

trans-unit.source: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

seg-source.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

target.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.
